TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class XmlNode : ICloneable, System.Collections.IEnumerable, System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XmlNode extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.ICloneable, class System.Xml.XPath.IXPathNavigable

Docs.summary: A node in an Xml document. Nodes may be of any of the types in the enumeration.
Docs.remarks: To create new nodes, use the Create methods of .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode AppendChild(class System.Xml.XmlNode newChild) cil managed

Docs.param: The node to add as a child.
Docs.summary: Add a given node as a child of this one.
Docs.remarks: If the is already a child of some node, then that relationship will be destroyed by this operation.

Docs.summary: The Xml attributes on this node.
Docs.value: A collection of attributes.
Docs.remarks: None.

Docs.summary: The base URI of the node.
Docs.value: The base URI of the node, or an empty string if the node has no base URI.
Docs.remarks: The base URI is the URI of the document containing the node. The base URI is set when the document containing this node is loaded. It cannot be modified.

Docs.summary: The children of this node.
Docs.value: The children of this node.
Docs.remarks: A node's children are an ordered list of nodes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode Clone() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a deep copy of this node.
Docs.returns: A new node cloned from this node in which all descendents of the node are copies of their counterpart descendents in the original node.
Docs.remarks: None.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode CloneNode(bool deep) cil managed

Docs.param: True to create a deep clone, or false to create a shallow clone.
Docs.summary: Creates a clone of the node.
Docs.remarks: If is true, all descendents of the new node are copies of their counterpart descendents in the original node. Otherwise, the children of the cloned node are the same objects as the children of the original.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator CreateNavigator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an located at the node.
Docs.remarks: The XPathNavigator can be used to perform XPath operations at the node.

Docs.summary: The first child of this node.
Docs.value: The first child of the node, or null if the node has no children.
Docs.remarks: None.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets an enumerator over the children of the node.
Docs.returns: An enumerator over the children of this node.
Docs.remarks: This is equivalent to calling ChildNodes.GetEnumerator().

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetNamespaceOfPrefix(string prefix) cil managed

Docs.param: A namespace prefix.
Docs.summary: Gets the URI associated with the given namespace prefix.
Docs.returns: The namespace URI corresponding to the prefix, or the empty string if no namespace corresponds to the prefix.
Docs.remarks: The attributes of this node and its ancestors are traversed until an xmlns: attribute is found. The value of that attribute is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetPrefixOfNamespace(string namespaceURI) cil managed

Docs.param: A namespace URI.
Docs.summary: Gets the prefix associated with the given namespace.
Docs.returns: The prefix corresponding to the namespace URI, or the empty string if no prefix corresponds to the URI.
Docs.remarks: The attributes of this node and its ancestors are traversed until an xmlns: attribute is found whose value is . The local name of the attribute is returned.

Docs.summary: Determines whether or not this node has children.
Docs.value: True if the node has children, otherwise false.
Docs.remarks: None.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string InnerText { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a textual value for this node.
Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'string'
Docs.remarks: The value of this property is a concatenation of all of the text nodes that are descendents of this node.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual string InnerXml { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the contents of the node as an Xml string.

value.para: The contents of the node as an Xml string. When getting the value of this property, InnerXml returns the same string that would write to an .
When setting the value of this property, the value is parsed as Xml, and the current children of the node are replaced by the nodes parsed from the string.

Docs.remarks: Setting this property is only valid for nodes which are not read-only and can have children.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Xml.XmlNode InsertAfter (System.Xml.XmlNode newChild, System.Xml.XmlNode refChild);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode InsertAfter(class System.Xml.XmlNode newChild, class System.Xml.XmlNode refChild) cil managed

Docs.param: The node to insert.
The node after which the new node is placed.
Docs.summary: Inserts a node after one of this node's children.
Docs.remarks: must be one of this node's children.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Xml.XmlNode InsertBefore (System.Xml.XmlNode newChild, System.Xml.XmlNode refChild);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.XmlNode InsertBefore(class System.Xml.XmlNode newChild, class System.Xml.XmlNode refChild) cil managed

Docs.param: The node to insert.
The node before which the new node is placed.
Docs.summary: Inserts a node before one of this node's children.
Docs.remarks: must be one of this node's children.

Docs.summary: Whether the node is read-only.
Docs.value: Whether the node is read-only.
Docs.remarks: A read-only node's set of children cannot be modified.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Xml.XmlElement this[string name] { get; }

Docs.param: The name of the child element to return.
Docs.summary: Gets the child element with the given name.
Docs.value: The child element whose is , or null if no child element has that name.

The namespace URI of the element to return.
Docs.summary: Gets the child element with the given local name and namespace URI.
Docs.value: The child element whose is and is , or null if no child element has that name.
Docs.remarks: None.

Docs.summary: The last child of this node.
Docs.value: The last child of this node, or null if the node has no children.
Docs.remarks: None.

Docs.summary: The local name of the node.
Docs.value: The local name of the node. For nodes with qualified names, the local name is the portion of the name after the colon.
Docs.remarks: The local name of the node is the name of the node when its is disregarded.

Docs.summary: The fully qualified name of the node.
Docs.value: The fully qualified name of the node.
Docs.remarks: This is a string consisting of both the and the of the node, separated by a ':' character.

Docs.summary: The Xml namespace of the node.
Docs.value: The URI of the namespace of the node.
Docs.remarks: None.

Docs.summary: The next sibling of the node.
Docs.value: The next node that follows this one, or null if this is the last node in its parent's children.
Docs.remarks: The node after this one in the 's collection.

Docs.summary: The type of the node.
Docs.value: A value from that indicates the type of this node.
Docs.remarks: You can also check the type of this node using the is operator.

Docs.summary: Gets a string representation of the node.

remarks.para: OuterXml returns the same string that would write to an .

Docs.summary: The document of which this node is a part.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlNodeList SelectNodes(string xpath) cil managed

Docs.param: The XPath expression.
Docs.summary: Run an XPath expression against this node.
Docs.returns: The nodes selected by the expression.

remarks.para: It compiles the argument XPath expression and evaluates it against this node and returns resulting nodes that match the expression as .
With this method namespaces cannot be considered. To select nodes which have namespace URI, use instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Xml.XmlNodeList SelectNodes (string xpath, System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager nsmgr);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlNodeList SelectNodes(string xpath, class System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager nsmgr) cil managed

Docs.param: The XPath expression.
The context in which to evaluate the expression, or null.
Docs.summary: Run an XPath expression against this node within a given context.
Docs.returns: The nodes selected by the expression.

remarks.para: It compiles the argument XPath expression and evaluates it against this node and returns resulting nodes that match the expression as .

The argument XPath expression is compiled with the argument . That is, the namespace prefixes used in have nothing to do with the actual property values in the tree. It is the namespace URIs stored in which are significant.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlNode SelectSingleNode(string xpath) cil managed

Docs.param: The XPath expression.
Docs.summary: Run an XPath expression against this node, returning the first matching node.
Docs.returns: The first node that matches the expression, or null if no node matches the expression.

remarks.para: It compiles the argument XPath expression and evaluates it against this node and returns resulting nodes that match the expression as .
With this method namespaces cannot be considered. To select nodes which have namespace URI, use instead.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Xml.XmlNode SelectSingleNode (string xpath, System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager nsmgr);
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlNode SelectSingleNode(string xpath, class System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager nsmgr) cil managed

Docs.param: The XPath expression.
The context in which to evaluate the expression, or null.
Docs.summary: Run an XPath expression against this node in a given context, returning the first matching node.
Docs.returns: The first node that matches the expression, or null if no node matches the expression.

remarks.para: It compiles the argument XPath expression and evaluates it against this node and returns the first node of resulting nodes that match the expression as .

The argument XPath expression is compiled with the argument . That is, the namespace prefixes used in have nothing to do with the actual property values in the tree. It is the namespace URIs stored in which are significant.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool Supports (string feature, string version);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool Supports(string feature, string version) cil managed

Docs.param: The feature name to test.
The feature version to test.
Docs.summary: Tests whether the node supports certain DOM features.
Docs.returns: Whether the feature/version pair is supported by the node.

remarks.para: This method currently returns true only when is "xml" and is "1.0" or "2.0". This is the equivalent behavior that W3C Document Object Model Level 2 expects. However, it does not mean that this document object model really conforms to the W3C standard. Actually it does not conform to the standard.

Docs.summary: The value of the node. This depends on it's .
Docs.value: The value of this node, or null if the node does not have a value.
Docs.remarks: Attribute values, processing instruction values, and other node values are returned by this property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteContentTo(class System.Xml.XmlWriter w) cil managed

Docs.param: The writer to write the nodes to.
Docs.summary: Writes the child nodes of this node to an .
Docs.remarks: This method is used to write its content nodes to the parameter . It does not write this node itself. For example, if this node is an element, the start and end tags are not written.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void WriteTo(class System.Xml.XmlWriter w) cil managed

Docs.param: The writer to write the nodes to.
Docs.summary: Writes the node and its children to an .
Docs.remarks: This method is used to write this node itself and its content nodes to the parameter .
